item.title: About
item.description: Dominic Magirr is a medical statistician at Cambridge Cancer Genomics, a precision-oncology start-up. Built with the blogdown package.

item.title: How to calculate the log-rank statistic
item.description: Suppose we have the following data. df <- dplyr::tibble(patient_id = as.character(1:12), treatment = rep(c("C", "E"), each = 6), survival_time = survival::Surv(time = c(2,6,8,11,17,24,7,9,13,22,23,25), event = c(1,1,1,1,1,0,1,1,1,0,0,0))) knitr::kable(df) patient_id treatment survival_time 1 C 2 2 C 6 3 C 8 4 C 11 5 C 17 6 C 24+ 7 E 7 8 E 9 9 E 13 10 E 22+ 11 E 23+ 12 E 25+ Letâ€™s arrange the data in increasing order of survival time.
